content.description: Face climb pockets with a few interesting moves midway up.
content.protection: 4 bolts.  Hook anchors with optional bolt for top roping.
content.location: 2nd to last route on the left side of the ledge.

climbs.name: Rubble With A Cause
climbs.fa: K. Cordner, D. Olson, D. Pedersen, T. Otto.

content.description: Tricky move above 5th bolt. crux is going to the 10th bolt. you need a 70m rope to do this route. lower off hook anchors.

content.protection: 4 bolts instead of 3 (on the direct) - 12 total.
content.location: Starts in a weakness just right of Pumpkin, joins after the 4th bolt.

content.description:
crux above the 7th bolt

excellent rock with lots of big holds
content.location: left of Sun Stroke (5.9) and Pumpkin.

content.description: Easy climbing off the ground leads to a couple of bigger moves after the third bolt. Layback off the flake to clip the anchors or worm your way around the back of the block. Route trends left.
content.location: 2nd route to the left once you are standing on the platform that forms the left side of the Attila the Hun Wall. Easiest looking route on this section of the wall.

content.description: Scramble up until it steepens and face climb to the crack. Good side pulls and hand jams inside the crack. The optional piece would really sow up the route. Few moves at the top make you think. Fun climb. Felt like the crux was at the last bolt.
content.protection:
5 bolts.

(optional gear piece: 1.5" piece not needed)

content.description: Starts off of the ledge on a vertical face.  Big holds lead up to a crux crimpy reach right at the third bolt.  Gain the arete and after a few moves, a good rest at a "hueco" like hold.  A technical traverse left, leads to more good holds up to the base of the curving arete.  Continuously tricky climbing follows the arete as it curves left to the final mantle to the chains.
content.protection: 11 bolts to chains (that's right you have to untie and feed)

content.description: At the top of the Attila the Hun wall, near the rim of the gorge is the namesake route. Super clean left leaning fingers to hands splitter. It is possible start on the Louisiana Liplock (10b), the VERY short finger crack below White Dwarf (12a), and link into Attila crack with some slings. If doing this, the route is probably more like 100 feet.
content.protection: Nuts, singles to .75, 2x 1 Camelot, and a #2.
content.location: Scramble up some ledges to the right of Pumpkin to the base. The cracks up there are easy to see from the trail.
